Headline: Rep. Jordan: Trump will be looking for a new attorney general
Summary: Republican congressman from Ohio says Rosenstein is making it difficult for lawmakers to do their job. On 'The Story,' Rep. Jordan says the Fusion GPS co-founder is concerned about criminal liability.

Headline: Pompeo meets with Saudi leaders following Khashoggi’s disappearance
Summary: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo met with Saudi Arabia’s leadership on Tuesday and said he stressed the need for a comprehensive investigation into the disappearance of activist Jamal Khashoggi.

Headline: Heitkamp apologizes for naming sexual assault, abuse victims in newspaper ad
Summary: Sen. Heidi Heitkamp, a Democrat from North Dakota, apologized Tuesday after naming victims of domestic violence and sexual abuse in an attack ad aimed at her Republican challenger -- after some of the women said they did not give permission for the campaign to name them, and others said they'd never experienced abuse in the first place.

Headline: Trump says he’ll hold Stormy Daniels, Michael Avenatti accountable for legal fees
Summary: President Trump on Tuesday assailed adult-film star Stormy Daniels’ lawyer Michael Avenatti, who is mulling a 2020 presidential run and is one of the president’s most vocal critics, after a federal judge tossed a defamation lawsuit against the president on Monday.

Headline: Sessions says he's 'pleased and honored' to be AG after Trump again signals recusal disappointment
Summary: Attorney General Jeff Sessions told reporters Tuesday that he was "pleased and honored" to be part of the Trump administration.

Headline: Liberal profs launch campaign to pack Supreme Court after Kavanaugh confirmation
Summary: Less than a month after the confirmation of Associate Justice Brett Kavanaugh entrenched a 5-4 conservative majority on the Supreme Court, leading law professors are urging Democrats to expand the size of all of the nation's federal courts and pack them with liberals.

Headline: Sen. Ben Cardin: Saudi family has some accountability
Summary: Democratic lawmaker from Maryland says Mnuchin should not be going to Saudi Arabia. On 'Your World,' Cardin believes the Khashoggi case will impact the U.S. relationship with Saudi Arabia.

Headline: Professor: Media overstating Warren's DNA test results; Hillary Clinton is still making excuses for Bill
Summary: Guests: Howie Carr, William Jacobson, Will Jawando, Camille Paglia, Richard Goodstein, Mark Steyn, Vijay Jojo Chokal-Ingam

Headline: Trump defeats Avenatti (and Stormy Daniels) again -- here's what's next for the controversial duo
Summary: Showman and ambitious Machiavellian porn lawyer Michael Avenatti has just learned an important lesson. It is easy to sue anyone, even the president of the United States. It is harder to prevail and even harder when, after you lose, the court orders you to pay the fees of opposing attorneys.

Headline: Warren’s lonesome tribe of one
Summary: Well that plan backfired.

Headline: Cuban diplomats hijack US event on political prisoners, causing chaos at UN
Summary: A U.S.-led event to draw attention to the plight of political prisoners in Cuba under the repressive communist government was hijacked Tuesday by pro-regime diplomats and protesters -- who screamed slogans and banged tables in a display an American diplomat called shameful.

Headline: DNA test reveals Sen. Elizabeth Warren could be 1/1,024th Native American
Summary: Reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

Headline: Dennis Hof, Nevada brothel owner, dead at 72
Summary: Nevada brothel owner Dennis Hof has died. He was 72.

Headline: Elizabeth Warren helps Republicans with her focus on her DNA instead of the midterms
Summary: When it comes to political mistakes, Elizabeth Warren – a likely candidate for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination – just made a doozy.

Headline: Political fallout from Jamal Khashoggi investigation
Summary: The Saudi government is considering whether to say that rogue intelligence operatives murdered activist and writer Jamal Khashoggi by mistake; reaction and analysis from the 'Special Report' All-Stars.

Headline: Warren's DNA test renews scrutiny of long history claiming Native-American heritage
Summary: The high-profile rollout of Elizabeth Warren’s DNA test is causing more headaches for the Democratic senator, as the results fuel Republican critics' claims that she used a trace amount of Native American heritage to advance her academic career.

Headline: Cuban dissident who carried lengthy hunger strike freed after US call for release
Summary: A Cuban dissident group said Tuesday the island's government has released Tomas Nunez Magdariaga, who had carried out a lengthy hunger strike to protest his imprisonment.

Headline: Meghan Trainor is 'texting people' to come to her wedding
Summary: Meghan Trainor got candid about some challenges she’s faced while planning her upcoming wedding.

Headline: Glenn Simpson, of Fusion GPS, pleads 5th on Capitol Hill amid questions over dossier
Summary: Glenn Simpson – the co-founder of the Fusion GPS research group that commissioned the unverified, Democrat-funded anti-Trump dossier – on Tuesday invoked his Fifth Amendment right not to testify during an appearance before the House Judiciary Committee.

Headline: Iran threatens US with warning that its ballistic missiles can now hit 'any ship' from 400 miles
Summary: Iran has said it has beefed up the capability of its missiles, warning they can now hit "any ship" up to 400 miles away.
